N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 §§ 635-4.5 - Requirements for financial records

State Regulations
(a) Each provider shall maintain service-specific financial records which reflect
expenditures made and revenues received. These service-specific financial
records shall be accounted for on either a program type or a site specific
basis in order to correspond with the cost report form and format specified by
OPWDD. (b) Such financial records
shall include, but not be limited to: (1)
salary and fringe benefit costs associated with the following categories: direct care, clinical, program administration, agency administration and
support; and
(2)
other than
personal service program costs, such as housekeeping and maintenance costs, program support, housing, utilities, transportation, rent, equipment, costs of
physical plant and amortization of leasehold improvements and related
expenses. (c) The
financial records shall include separate accounts for each type of expense and
revenue included in the budget or cost report. The provider may establish
subaccount and control accounts as are necessary for meeting OPWDD's
requirements for fiscal reporting and effective financial management. (d) Record retention. Providers must maintain all cost reports, budget reports, data and other reports submitted to OPWDD under this Subpart. Providers must
also maintain all underlying records which formed the basis for or which
support such reports and data submitted to OPWDD. The period of retention shall
be as follows: (1)

Reports and data
submitted to OPWDD, and underlying records, shall be kept for six years after
the due date of the report or data, or the date the reports or data were
submitted, whichever is later. (2)

If the reports and/or data were used to establish a rate/fee/price, the reports
and/or data and underlying records shall be kept for six years from the date
the rate/fee/price was established. Notes
